meanings.definition: To go away from; depart from
meanings.sent1: She lefte the party early to catch the last bus home.
meanings.sent2: The train lefte the station right on time.
meanings.sent3: He lefte the meeting abruptly, forgetting his briefcase.
meanings.sent4: The sun lefte the sky, painting it with hues of orange and pink.
meanings.sent5: The bird lefte its nest, soaring into the clear blue sky.

meanings.definition: To remain as a residue; remain
meanings.sent1: After the rain, puddles lefte on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent2: A faint scent lefte in the room after she sprayed perfume.
meanings.sent3: The taste of chocolate lefte on his tongue, making him crave more.
meanings.sent4: Memories of the past lefte in her mind, bringing a smile to her face.
meanings.sent5: The warmth of the sun lefte on her skin, comforting and gentle.

meanings.definition: To put or keep in a safe or convenient place
meanings.sent1: She lefte her keys on the table by the door.
meanings.sent2: He lefte his phone charging overnight on the nightstand.
meanings.sent3: The cat lefte her favorite toy under the bed as a surprise.
meanings.sent4: The treasure was lefte hidden in the old chest for generations.
meanings.sent5: He lefte a note on the fridge to remind himself of the appointment.

meanings.definition: To cause to remain as a residue; leave behind
meanings.sent1: The storm lefte a trail of destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent2: His words lefte a lasting impact on her heart.
meanings.sent3: The chef lefte a sprinkle of herbs on top for added flavor.
meanings.sent4: The artist lefte a signature in the corner of the painting.
meanings.sent5: The explorer lefte footprints in the sand, marking his journey.
